    • Method Detail

      • parseArguments

        public static Map<String,Object> parseArguments(String[] args)
        This method parses the arguments from an array of Strings. Possible arguments are:
        • -h, or --help: shows online information about all available arguments and exits;
        • -d, or --default: for every non specified argument, uses default values;
        • -s, or --save: saves current configuration;
        • -t=PORT, or --tcp-port=PORT: sets PORT as TCP port;
        • -u=PORT, or --udp-port=PORT: sets PORT as UDP port;
        • -m=PORT, or --mc-port=PORT: sets PORT as multicast port;
        • -r=PORT, or --rmi-port=PORT: sets PORT as RMI port;
        • -m=IP, or --mc-group=IP: sets IP as multicast group address;
        • -k=NUM, or --keep-alive=NUM: sets NUM as Keep Alive interval (milliseconds);
        • -L=PERIOD, or --log-duration=PERIOD: sets PERIOD as log duration (see OnlineUsers.setLogDuration(String)). PERIOD must be in PnDTnHnMn.nS format (ISO-8601 standard);
        • -R=PERIOD, or --request-duration=PERIOD: sets PERIOD as request duration (see User.setFriendRequestDuration(String)). PERIOD must be in PnDTnHnMn.nS format (ISO-8601 standard);
        All unrecognized arguments will be ignored.

        Returns a Map of Strings (the name of the argument) and Objects (the value of the argument). This is the list of the possible argument names with their relative value types:

        Option Key Value Type
        -d, --default "default" Boolean (true)
        -s, --save "save" Boolean (true)
        -t, --tcp-port "tcp_port" Long
        -u, --udp-port "udp_port" Long
        -m, --mc-port "mc_port" Long
        -r, --rmi-port "rmi_port" Long
        -k, --keep-alive "keep_alive_millis" Long
        -m, --mc-group "mc_group" String
        -L, --log-duration "log_duration" String
        -R, --request-duration "request_duration" String
        Parameters:
        args - the array of arguments
        Returns:
        a Map of Strings (the name of the argument) and Objects (the value of the argument)

      • loadConfiguration

        public static Map<String,Object> loadConfiguration()
        Loads the configuration from a JSON file named "conf.json" located in the directory DATA_DIR_PATH.

        The file must have the following attributes:

        • tcp_port: the TCP port of the server;
        • udp_port: the UDP port of the server;
        • mc_port: the multicast port of the server;
        • rmi_port: the RMI port of the server;
        • mc_group: the IP of the multicast group;
        • keep_alive_millis: the interval in milliseconds between a Keep Alive signal and another;
        • log_duration: the duration of a login;
        • request_duration: the duration of a friend request.

        Returns a Map of Strings (the name of the attribute) and Objects (the value of the attribute).

        Returns:
        a Map of Strings (the name of the attribute) and Objects (the value of the attribute)
        See Also:
        storeConfiguration()

      • storeConfiguration

        public static void storeConfiguration()
        Stores the configuration in a JSON file named "conf.json" located in the directory DATA_DIR_PATH.

        The generated file may be reloaded using the method loadConfiguration()

      • loadUsersDB

        public static UsersDB loadUsersDB()
        Loads the users database from a file named "users.db" located in the directory DATA_DIR_PATH. If the file does not exist or an error occurs, creates a new UsersDB instance.
        Returns:
        the UsersDB object found in the file, or a new one if it's not found

      • storeUsersDB

        public static void storeUsersDB(UsersDB usersDB)
        Stores the user database in a file named "users.db" located in the directory DATA_DIR_PATH.

        The generated file may be reloaded using the method loadUsersDB()

        Parameters:
        usersDB - the UsersDB object to be stored

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Main method. Start a textual interface that will prompt any interaction with the various SimpleSocial clients connected.
        Parameters:
        args - the server options (see parseArguments(String[]))
